name: Industry
description: Industrialization - the main prerequisite for prosperity lies in increasing per-capita production values and freeing people from having to do menial low-value tasks. That means automation, power generation and logistics. I'll have to go through industrial history fast if I want to achieve my objective in my lifetime.

quests.name: Basic Smelting
quests.description: The core of industry - the ability to smelt and alloy metals. This basic smeltery design is much more versatile that its simplicity suggests.

quests.name: The Miner's Path
quests.description: This is going to be complicated. It appears I will have to go through a sequence of pickaxes before I have one I can use everywhere. I'll have to pay close attention to possible upgrades, and when it's more advantageous to upgrade a pickaxe or to make a new one. Damn those engineers for losing our digital miner.

quests.name: The New World Bucketeers
quests.description: Who would've thought it's such a hassle to make a simple metal bucket. Well, it's not as if I didn't need a power infrastructure anyway, so let's get to it.

quests.name: Powering Up
quests.description: Wind and water have low power output for now, but at least they don't require fuel, or a lot of maintenance.

quests.name: Basic Circuitry
quests.description: It's not an ME network, but it's a start

quests.name: Logistics 101
quests.description: Automated transport - an integral part of industrialization. There are several ways to go about this. All have their specific advantages and restrictions.

quests.name: Automated Logistics
quests.description: Put everything where it belongs, take everything where it's needed.

quests.name: Automated Mining
quests.description: The end of the pickaxe age.

quests.name: Enhanced Presence
quests.description: Be where I'm needed. Instantly. This....appeals.

quests.name: Advanced Industrial Processes
quests.description: I can make almost anything. Really.

quests.name: The Packrat's Dream
quests.description: At last! Once I have this going, I won't need to worry about storage every again. If I set things up correctly.

quests.name: Interdimensional Logistics
quests.description: This puts a new meaning to "anywhere".

quests.name: Automatic Crafting
quests.description: "Everything that you need to do more than once should be automated. Doing this manually twice and more often is a waste of your time"

quests.name: Even More Power
quests.description: There is no such thing as "enough power"

quests.name: Even More Power
quests.description: No, really, there isn't such a  thing as "enough power"

tasks.longDescription: The industrial coil is the bedrock type

quests.name: Ultimate Automated Mining
quests.description: If I had something that mines all valuables and replaces it with stone, and does that at a good speed, it would be the ultimate solution to any mining problems.

quests.name: Nuclear Power
quests.description: I am hesitant to go here....yet there is no alternative for a civilization that will be able to reach the stars. Everything after this will only be more dangerous. Consider this a test of our responsibility.

quests.name: Fusion Power
quests.description: All right...this may be enough power at last. Expensive though. I should collect about 50K HSLA steel, 30K coal, 30K lodestones and 20K wool before I start this.

quests.name: Automatic Building
quests.description: No more manual clearing of space, and if I ever need to build several identical structures, this is how I can do it.

quests.name: Fueling Up
quests.description: Why the heck can't everything run on the same kind of fuel...

quests.name: Advanced Controls
quests.description: Computers - maybe this time we'll use them without cutting down whole forests for printing paper.

quests.name: Basic Steelmaking
quests.description: This may not be the most efficient steelmaking process, but it is what I have for now.
